comments.raw_text:
I'm getting an assertion in mozilla-central changeset 77594 (tip on 2011-09-26), "Uh, cx is not the current JS context!" in nsScriptSecurityManager.cpp:395.

I've built m-c with the following .mozconfig:

ac_add_options --enable-application=browser
ac_add_options --enable-debug
ac_add_options --enable-tests
ac_add_options --disable-angle
ac_add_options --disable-jemalloc

I can reproduce 100% of the time by:

1) install extension at https://github.com/mozilla-services/sync-spray (commit 1ea65280f4e82b55 repros)
2) go to about:sync-spray
3) hit the button

I get this assertion every time.

It is a possibility that Jetpack isn't doing things properly on its end. But, I'm no expert with this neck of the woods.

Since I have Nightly built in debug mode, I'm able to open a debugger when this assertion is thrown. Just tell me what values you want and I'll happily add them to the bug. Or, I can get a dump file for someone to churn on.
comments.author: gps@mozilla.com
